intro: Lasianthus obtusus, commonly known as the broad-leaved lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a bluish-green hue. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
